00012 ConvergenceTable::ConvergenceTable( const Wrapper<StatisticsMC>& Inner_ )
00013  : Inner( Inner_ ), PathsDone( 0 )
00014 {
00015   // Use a convenient set of defaults
00016   Increment = 2;
00017   StoppingPoint = Increment;
00018   MaxSets = 20;
00019 }
00020 
00021 StatisticsMC* ConvergenceTable::clone() const
00022 {
00023   return new ConvergenceTable( *this );
00024 }
00025 
00026 void ConvergenceTable::GetResultsFromInner( std::vector<std::vector<double> >& results_ ) const
00027 {
00028   // Get the 2D vector of results from the inner
00029   // For a StatisticsMean, this is just a 1D vector, but allow for arbitrary
00030   // 2D size
00031   std::vector<std::vector<double> > thisResult( Inner->GetResultsSoFar() );
00032 
00033   // Iterate over all the rows of the returned result, store them in order
00034   // at the end of the supplied table, along with the PathsDone
00035   for (unsigned long i=0; i<thisResult.size(); i++)
00036   {
00037     thisResult[i].push_back(PathsDone);
00038     results_.push_back(thisResult[i]);
00039   }
00040 }
00041 
00042 void ConvergenceTable::AddOneResult( double result )
00043 {
00044   // Get the work done by the 'Inner' statistics gatherer
00045   Inner->AddOneResult( result );
00046   ++PathsDone;
00047 
00048   // If we have hit a power of Increment, we ask the 'Inner' for the results so far,
00049   // and add it to our array (along with the number of points that contributed to that result)
00050   if (PathsDone == StoppingPoint)
00051   {
00052     StoppingPoint *= Increment;
00053     GetResultsFromInner( ResultsSoFar );
00054   }
00055 }
00056 
00057 // Add in one set of results to our convergence table
00058 void ConvergenceTable::AddOneSetOfResults( long Number_, 
00059                 std::vector<std::vector<double> > &ResultsSoFar_ )
00060 {
00061   // If this sends us past the next StoppingPoint, then store current results
00062   // as long as we haven't just added the results, and we're not at zero
00063   // (note: this is ResultsSoFar, not ResultsSoFar_)
00064   if ( PathsDone + Number_ >= StoppingPoint && 
00065        PathsDone*Increment != StoppingPoint && 
00066        PathsDone != 0 )
00067     GetResultsFromInner( ResultsSoFar );
00068 
00069   // Now, pass on this set to the inner statistics gatherer
00070   Inner->AddOneSetOfResults( Number_, ResultsSoFar_ );
00071   // Set our total number of points
00072   PathsDone += Number_;
00073   StoppingPoint = _FindNextPowerOfTwo( PathsDone );
00074 
00075   GetResultsFromInner( ResultsSoFar );
00076 }
00077 
00078 void ConvergenceTable::Reset()
00079 {
00080   // Pass on the order to the inner
00081   Inner->Reset();
00082   // Set our results to zero
00083   PathsDone = 0;
00084   StoppingPoint = Increment;
00085   ResultsSoFar.clear();
00086 }
00087 
00088 void ConvergenceTable::SetResultsSoFar( long Number_, 
00089         std::vector<std::vector<double> > &ResultsSoFar_ )
00090 {
00091   // Pass on the results to the inner
00092   Inner->SetResultsSoFar( Number_, ResultsSoFar_ );
00093   // Set out total number of points
00094   PathsDone = Number_;
00095   // Set the next stopping point at which to record to the convergence table
00096   StoppingPoint = _FindNextPowerOfTwo( PathsDone );
00097   // Add this current point to our convergence table
00098   GetResultsFromInner( ResultsSoFar );
00099 }
00100 
00101 std::vector<std::vector<double> > ConvergenceTable::GetResultsSoFar() const
00102 {
00103   // Start with the results given so far
00104   std::vector<std::vector<double> > tmp( ResultsSoFar );
00105 
00106   // and now add in the current result from the inner object,
00107   // If we have just hit a power of increment, the result now is identical
00108   // with that in the last entry in ResultsSoFar, so we don't have
00109   // to add this extra point.
00110   if ( (PathsDone*Increment) != StoppingPoint )
00111   {
00112     GetResultsFromInner( tmp );
00113   }
00114   
00115   // So now we have a vector of (mean, sd, number) for powers of increment, and the final total
00116   return tmp;
00117 }
00118 
00119 // Allow us to send ConvergenceTable objects to an ostream
00120 // For ease of output to file
00121 std::ostream& operator<<( std::ostream& out, const ConvergenceTable& conTab )
00122 {
00123   // First, send the Inner to the stream
00124   out << *( static_cast<const StatisticsMean*> ( conTab.Inner.GetConstPointer() ) );
00125 
00126   // Now, send the convergence table to the stream
00127   // One entry of this will duplicate the current state of the inner.
00128   // First, a separator
00129   out << " ,";
00130 
00131   // Get all the results from the convergence table
00132   std::vector<std::vector<double> > thisResult( conTab.GetResultsSoFar() );
00133   // What is the length of the array of results?
00134   long len = thisResult.size();
00135   // How many results are we going to write to the file?
00136   long imax; ( len > conTab.MaxSets ) ? imax = conTab.MaxSets : imax = len;
00137   
00138   // Now, print them to the stream
00139   out << " " << imax;
00140 
00141   long jmax;
00142   for ( long i=len-imax; i<len; ++i )
00143   {
00144     jmax = thisResult[i].size();
00145     out << " " << jmax;
00146     for ( long j=0; j<jmax; ++j )
00147       out << " " << thisResult[i][j];
00148   }
00149 
00150   return ( out );
00151 }
00152 
00153 // Read in elements of the convergence table
00154 std::istream& operator>>( std::istream& in, ConvergenceTable& conTab )
00155 {
00156   // First, read in the Inner
00157   in >> *( static_cast<StatisticsMean*> ( conTab.Inner.GetPointer() ) );
00158 
00159   // Now, restore the state of the convergence table
00160   // First, the separator
00161   std::string strTmp;
00162   in >> strTmp;
00163 
00164   std::vector<std::vector<double> > theResults;
00165   long len;
00166 
00167   // First, get the number of results that the convergence table is holding
00168   in >> len;
00169   theResults.resize( len );
00170 
00171   long jmax;
00172   // Now, iterate through each set
00173   for ( long i=0; i<len; ++i )
00174   {
00175     in >> jmax;
00176     theResults[i].resize( jmax );
00177     for ( long j=0; j<jmax; ++j )
00178       in >> theResults[i][j];
00179   }
00180 
00181   conTab.ResultsSoFar = theResults;
00182 
00183   return ( in );
00184 }
